channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Around 155 people a day died of COVID-19 in August — DOH
item.author: Christian Deiparine
item.description: Health Undersecretary Maria Rosario Vergeire said the average daily deaths last month was at 155, or the country seeing a total of 4,816 fatalities.

item.title: PNP to form task group on killing of former mayoral candidate of Abra town
item.description: The doctor previously ran for mayor in Pilar during the 2019 local elections.

item.title: DOH reports 18,937 more COVID-19 cases
item.description: Monday's new cases pushed the Philippines' total COVID count to 2,385,616.

item.title: Delta is now 'most common' COVID-19 variant in Philippines
item.author: Christian Deiparine
item.description: Health Undersecretary Maria Rosario Vergeire told a briefing that Delta now accounts for 24.2% of variant cases from the 12,530 samples sent for genome sequencing.

item.title: Ex-ICC judge: Probers can get evidence on killings even if barred from Philippines
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: Pangalangan said evidence can be in the form of "statements, of course, by individuals and, in fact, in a very recent case by the court, even...statements from social media."

item.title: CHR supports call to prioritize health workers in COVID-19 vaccine booster shots
item.description: The Commission on Human Rights said Monday that it supports vaccine czar Carlito Galvez’s earlier statement to prioritize healthcare workers in the administration of booster shots, when already allowed by the government.

item.title: Philippines approves limited return to classroom learning
item.author: Christian Deiparine
item.description: The move paves the way for reopening schools, albeit at a minimum capacity in the Philippines, among the last two countries in the world with no return to classrooms before this.

item.title: Enrollment in K-12 surpasses pre-pandemic level — DepEd
item.author: Christian Deiparine
item.description: The figure — 28,219,623 to be exact, is against the 27,790,114 in School Year 2019 to 2020, according to DepEd's quick count.

item.title: Solon files House bill seeking to abolish DBM’s procurement service
item.description: “The PS-DBM has also been hounded by allegations of improper procedure and overpriced acquisitions,” the Cagayan de Oro City representative also said.

item.title: JBC opens application for seat of Justice Carandang who will retire in January 2022
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: The Judicial and Bar Council has opened the application and recommendation period for the post to be vacated by Supreme Court Associate Justice Rosmari Carandang, who will retire early next year.
